revised_title: Royal Society Expedition to Tristan Da Cunha: Preserving Unique Biota and Ecosystems
tldr: The Royal Society expedition to Tristan Da Cunha in 1962 aimed to study the unique fauna and flora of the isolated islands. The author highlights the importance of understanding the factors governing colonization of isolated regions and the ecological balance between endemic species. The expedition also aimed to preserve the natural ecosystems before human impact significantly alters them. Conservation efforts are crucial to maintain individual species and ecosystems for scientific and aesthetic value.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Conservation Biology
